title: Pharmacology Vocabulary
description: Explore the science of medicines and drugs, from how medications work in the body to drug interactions and pharmaceutical terms.

questions.question: What does 'pharmacology' study?
options: The manufacturing of pills
The study of pharmacy buildings
The history of medicine
The science of how drugs interact with biological systems

questions.question: What is a 'dose' in pharmacology?
options: The measured quantity of a drug to be taken at one time
The shelf life of a drug
A side effect of a medication
A type of medicine

questions.question: What does 'analgesic' mean?
options: A drug that stops bleeding
A drug that relieves pain without causing loss of consciousness
A drug that causes sleep
A drug that reduces fever

questions.question: What is a 'side effect'?
options: An unwanted or secondary effect that occurs in addition to the desired therapeutic effect
A drug interaction
The expiration of a medication
The main purpose of a drug

questions.question: What does 'bioavailability' measure?
options: The size of a pill
The cost of a medication
The proportion of a drug that reaches the bloodstream and is available to have an active effect
How long a drug lasts on the shelf

questions.question: What is a 'placebo'?
options: A powerful painkiller
A drug that cures all diseases
A new type of antibiotic
An inactive substance given in place of a real drug, often used in clinical trials

questions.question: What does 'contraindication' mean?
options: A positive drug interaction
A recommendation to take a drug
The correct dosage of a drug
A condition or factor that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable

questions.question: What is 'half-life' in pharmacology?
options: The shelf life divided by two
Half the recommended dose
Half the duration of treatment
The time it takes for the concentration of a drug in the body to be reduced by half

questions.question: What is an 'antipyretic'?
options: A drug that reduces swelling
A drug that prevents infection
A drug that relieves pain
A drug that reduces fever

questions.question: What does 'drug interaction' refer to?
options: The absorption of a drug in the stomach
Taking a drug as prescribed
The manufacturing of a drug
When one drug affects the activity or effectiveness of another drug when both are taken together

questions.question: What is a 'generic drug'?
options: A brand-name drug
A drug that requires a prescription
A medication that is equivalent to a brand-name drug but sold under its chemical name at a lower cost
A drug still being tested

questions.question: What does 'pharmacokinetics' study?
options: How the body absorbs, distributes, metabolizes, and excretes drugs
How drugs are manufactured
The chemical structure of drugs
The history of drug discovery

questions.question: What is 'tolerance' in pharmacology?
options: The ability to swallow large pills
A condition where the body requires increasingly larger doses of a drug to achieve the same effect
The maximum safe dose of a drug
A drug's shelf stability

questions.question: What is an 'antihistamine'?
options: A drug that prevents blood clots
A drug that increases blood pressure
A drug that counteracts the effects of histamine, commonly used to treat allergies
A type of vitamin

questions.question: What does 'over-the-counter' (OTC) mean for medications?
options: A drug that must be injected
A drug that is experimental
A drug that is only available in hospitals
A drug that can be purchased without a prescription
